ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to conduct a thorough literature review in psychology.
Knowledge of how to code an experiment and analyze data, how to think like a scientist in literature searches, interpreting study results, developing an experiment for my own senior project.
I learned how to develop a question and to analyze data and to write academically.
learned a great deal about research skills as I had never conducted my own experiment before!

Had the opportunity to do independent research for my senior thesis, including a literature review, data collection, and analysis. Also gained wet lab experience! Learned a lot about nonhuman primate research and early life adversity and its connection to biomarkers of chronic stress and inflammation.
Senior thesis
I learned how to conduct independent research and how to do my own spin on data analyses to assess my outcomes of interest.

I learnt how to conduct network analysis of longitudinal daily diary data collected over three weeks. Particularly, I learnt how to analyze how the interactions between eating disorder symptoms and self-conscious emotions change over time using statistical tests such as the network comparison test.

I learned about time management, self-discipline, and excitingly practical resources when it came to examining real world questions. I especially enjoyed learning more about public health law and the synergy between law and psychology.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: very flexible in terms of making your own schedule, meetings with your advisor, asking questions
Weaknesses: not much guidance up front and was initially confused about the submission page on Canvas (it was the same as the fall page and labelled as fall even though I completed it in the spring)

Weakness potentially that it is difficult to prepare for this course since no class really teaches you beforehand how to come up with your own experiment and coding and everything. So it would be nicer to have a more smooth transition from taking classes into independently having to come up with your own project, not really having any experience in research.
But the strength on the other hand is that you have your advisor to teach, guide, and direct you, so that you learn along the way of experiencing the whole process of designing your own experiment and analyzing and writing about it.
i learned so much from this course and would recommend anyone to do a BS and conduct independent research

Strengths: my advisor! super responsive and cared about my project, also helped me in finding post-grad opportunities
Weaknesses: none I can think of :)

The structure provided by weekly meetings was very helpful for me to be able to keep up with the work and not leave it all to the last couple weeks, and also allowed me to get constance feedback and guidance if I needed it.

I received weekly feedback that helped me organize my ideas and analytical plan. Additionally, finishing the introduction and method of the paper in the Fall semester and finishing the results and discussion in the Spring semester allowed me to manage the amount of workload required for the thesis.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Great way to end the psychology major
Obviously this course is required for your senior thesis...
I would recommend this course to another student, granted they have as helpful an advisor as Maria Gendron.
yes!

Highly recommend this option for those doing their thesis, you get to delve deep into a topic you're interested in and have a lot of flexiblity in how you structure your project (depending on your advisor)
Yes, I think for any students working in a lab doing your senior essay this way (with your lab) is a very good way to go.
Yes. It is an excellent opportunity for a self-driven and academically curious experience.
